availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ezekiel Vinson, Jr. (Trigg County, Kentucky, carpenter and postmaster)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, carpenter and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth E. Moore Vinson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on June 25, 1845. Father of Henrietta S. Vinson, Eliza D. Vinson, Dewitt H. Vinson, and Missouri A. Vinson. Married to Nancy J. Moore Vinson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on August 18, 1852. Father of Mary T. Vinson, Lee Vinson, Robert Vinson, and James Vinson. United States postmaster in Trigg County from October 7, 1846, to March 10, 1857. Carpenter in Trigg County in 1850. Carpenter in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 361A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 191.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia District, p. 433A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, 000321335, p.104.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Marriages, p.146.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Trigg County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 729.
"Ezekiel Vinson Jr. (1821-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial 46256332, accessed May 3, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46256332.
